item.title: Changing the auto generated passwords in vCloud
item.description: In VMware’s vCloud Director, when a VM is deployed using the guest customization, you can either supply a password for the administrator user or have vCloud auto-generate a password. The auto-generated passwords are 8 characters long and use upper-case, lower-case, numbers and special characters for example “q#Tv21*a”. If the 8 characters is not long enough for you you can increase the character length by changing a field in the database.
